title: Online Self-Compassion Workshop
blurb: Four-week virtual workshop for practicing mindfulness, kindness, and resilience.
description: This four-week workshop is designed to help you be less self-critical and more compassionate to yourself. Each weekly session combines worksheets, practical exercises, meditations, and discussions focused on building mindfulness and compassion. Participants also receive at-home workbook activities to reinforce new skills.

title: International Education Movie Night
blurb: Screening of the acclaimed film "The Price" followed by discussion.
description: Celebrate International Week at UIC with a screening of the globally acclaimed film "The Price" (2017) by Nigerian American filmmaker Anthony Onah. Stay for a post-screening discussion hosted by the Office of Global Engagement.

title: Online Managing Your Mood Workshop
blurb: Structured skills-based workshop for stress and mood management.
description: A four-week, structured program that draws on cognitive-behavioral and dialectical-behavioral therapy techniques to help students manage stress, anxiety, and other difficult emotions. Includes worksheets, activities, and guided discussion.

title: The CREATE Program: Accomplishments and Updates
blurb: Urban Transportation Center presentation on CREATE rail projects.
description: Hear from Velicia Goode, P.E., and Rebecca Wingate on the latest Chicago Region Environmental and Transportation Efficiency Program (CREATE) projects. Learn how the partnership improves the way passengers and goods move across metropolitan Chicago.

title: UIC Certificate in Nonprofit Management Fall Courses
blurb: Online CNM courses covering fundraising, social media, and operations.
description: New online courses for UIC’s Certificate in Nonprofit Management are open for registration. Highlights include Creating and Managing Fundraising Plans, Social Media Strategies for Nonprofits, and Fundamentals of Operations Management and Organizational Effectiveness. Continuing student discounts are available when registering for two or more courses.

title: Take a Break with Pawfficer Ham
blurb: Destress with Pawfficer Ham at the Library of the Health Sciences.
description: Take a break and enjoy some snuggles with the one and only Pawfficer Ham. This light-hearted event offers free love and stress relief for all visitors.

title: School of Public Health Global Health Speaker Series
blurb: Featured talk on pandemic preparedness with Dr. Richard J. Webby.
location: UIC School of Public Health (Room 160 + Zoom)
description: The School of Public Health’s Community Café and Global Health Speaker Series welcomes Richard J. Webby, director of the WHO Collaborating Centre for Studies on the Ecology of Influenza in Animals and Birds. Join in person or via Zoom to learn about preparations for the next pandemic.
audience: UIC students, faculty, staff, and the public

title: Creating Inclusive Digital Materials
blurb: Interactive workshop on accessibility best practices for documents and slides.
description: Explore best practices for creating accessible documents and slide decks using incremental improvements inspired by universal design principles. Includes hands-on evaluation of Microsoft Word documents and PowerPoint slides to apply accessibility strategies in real time.

title: UIC GIS Day
blurb: Celebrate GIS with talks, posters, and a skills workshop at Daley Library.
description: Join the UIC University Library and the College of Urban Planning and Public Affairs for GIS Day. Stay connected with evolving geospatial ideas, view student posters, and participate in a skills workshop on coordinate systems and projections. Doors open at 9:30 a.m. with coffee; talks begin at 10 a.m.
